sourceMeaningMnemonic: You have two <radical>bow</radical>s but they're both covered in <radical>ice</radical>. This has made them very <kanji>weak</kanji>.
meaningInfo: Just look at these weak, iced over bows. If you tried to draw back their strings they'd snap into a million pieces.
readingMnemonic: You give up on your trip and bring the <kanji>weak</kanji> bows back to your car, but it's stuck in the ice and snow. You decide to use the bows as a <reading>jack</reading> (<ja>じゃく</ja>) to try to get your car unstuck. Unfortunately, they're just too weak and they break in half.
readingInfo: Now you're stuck with two weak broken bows and no jack. Ice is lame.
